law.catch_line: Reporting federal adjusted gross income attributed to husband and wife -- Allocation of income and business deductions between husband and wife.

text.section: If the federal adjusted gross income of husband or wife is entered on a separate federal return, their Kentucky adjusted gross incomes may be entered on their separate Kentucky tax returns or their joint Kentucky tax return as they so elect.

If the federal adjusted gross income of husband and wife is entered on a joint federal return, or if neither files a federal return:
Their adjusted gross income shall be entered on their joint Kentucky tax return; or
Separate adjusted gross incomes may be entered on their separate Kentucky tax returns if they so elect.

law.history: Created 1990 Ky. Acts ch. 476, Pt. VII D, sec. 639, effective April 11, 1990.
